entries.name: _strptime(string[, format='%FT%T%z'])  →  hashclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Parses the given representation of date and time with the given template, and returns a hash of parsed elements.  _strptime does not support specification of flags and width unlike strftime.

entries.name: civil([year=-4712[, month=1[, mday=1[, hour=0[, minute=0[, second=0[, offset=0[, start=Date::ITALY]]]]]]]])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a DateTime object denoting the given calendar date.

entries.name: commercial([cwyear=-4712[, cweek=1[, cwday=1[, hour=0[, minute=0[, second=0[, offset=0[, start=Date::ITALY]]]]]]]])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a DateTime object denoting the given week date.

entries.name: httpdate(string='Mon, 01 Jan -4712 00:00:00 GMT'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new DateTime object by parsing from a string according to some RFC 2616 format.

entries.name: iso8601(string='-4712-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new DateTime object by parsing from a string according to some typical ISO 8601 formats.

entries.name: jd([jd=0[, hour=0[, minute=0[, second=0[, offset=0[, start=Date::ITALY]]]]]])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a DateTime object denoting the given chronological Julian day number.

entries.name: jisx0301(string='-4712-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new DateTime object by parsing from a string according to some typical JIS X 0301 formats.

entries.name: new([year=-4712[, month=1[, mday=1[, hour=0[, minute=0[, second=0[, offset=0[, start=Date::ITALY]]]]]]]])    →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a DateTime object denoting the given calendar date.

entries.name: now([start=Date::ITALY])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a DateTime object denoting the present time.

entries.name: ordinal([year=-4712[, yday=1[, hour=0[, minute=0[, second=0[, offset=0[, start=Date::ITALY]]]]]]])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a DateTime object denoting the given ordinal date.

entries.name: parse(string='-4712-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'[, comp=true[, start=Date::ITALY]])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Parses the given representation of date and time, and creates a DateTime object.  This method does not function as a validator.

entries.name: rfc2822(string='Mon, 1 Jan -4712 00:00:00 +0000'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new DateTime object by parsing from a string according to some typical RFC 2822 formats.

entries.name: rfc3339(string='-4712-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new DateTime object by parsing from a string according to some typical RFC 3339 formats.

entries.name: rfc822(string='Mon, 1 Jan -4712 00:00:00 +0000'[, start=Date::ITALY])   →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new DateTime object by parsing from a string according to some typical RFC 2822 formats.

entries.name: strptime([string='-4712-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'[, format='%FT%T%z'[ ,start=Date::ITALY]]])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Parses the given representation of date and time with the given template, and creates a DateTime object.  strptime does not support specification of flags and width unlike strftime.

entries.name: weeknum(p1 = v1, p2 = v2, p3 = v3, p4 = v4, p5 = v5, p6 = v6, p7 = v7, p8 = v8, p9 = v9)
xmlschema(string='-4712-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'[, start=Date::ITALY])  →  datetimeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new DateTime object by parsing from a string according to some typical XML Schema formats.

entries.name: hour  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the hour (0-23).

entries.name: jisx0301([n=0])  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a string in a JIS X 0301 format. The optional argument n is the number of digits for fractional seconds.

entries.name: minute  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the minute (0-59).

entries.name: new_offset([offset=0])  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Duplicates self and resets its offset.

entries.name: offset  →  rationalclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the offset.

entries.name: rfc3339([n=0])  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is equivalent to strftime('%FT%T%:z'). The optional argument n is the number of digits for fractional seconds.

entries.name: sec_fraction     →  rationalclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the fractional part of the second.

entries.name: second  →  fixnumclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the second (0-59).

entries.name: second_fraction  →  rationalclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the fractional part of the second.

entries.name: strftime([format='%FT%T%:z'])  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Formats date according to the directives in the given format string. The directives begin with a percent (%) character. Any text not listed as a directive will be passed through to the output string.

entries.name: to_date  →  dateclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a Date object which denotes self.

entries.name: to_datetime  →  selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns self.

entries.name: to_s  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a string in an ISO 8601 format. (This method doesn't use the expanded representations.)

entries.name: to_time  →  timeclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a Time object which denotes self.

entries.name: zone  →  stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the timezone.
